website_summaries.verdict: Must-have medicine to lather on skin before entering places that may have poison ivy, sumac or oak.
pros: Reviewers, especially those who are highly allergic to certain plants, say this barrier cream means they can once again enter areas that may have poisonous plants
Countless owners swear they've never suffered rashes or blisters after using this product
cons: If you forget to put it on and come into contact with poison ivy, this product won't help you

customer_reviews.title: This stuff WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I have a terrible reaction to Poison Ivy and avoid it like the plague! I recently had to clear a large area of land that had a lot of the nasty stuff hiding under small brush. I used this product and wound up with 1 tiny Poison Ivy blister after 4 days of non-stop exposure to the plant. I will use this stuff every time there is even a HINT of the plant!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer 1

customer_reviews.title: gel....will see how it does in action
customer_reviews.text: I know some people have given this bad reviews....yes if you go wading out in poison ivy, oak nothing is going to totally prevent an outbreak...this helps to keep from getting it...but if you think its gonna stop a rash when your bathing in poison plants you need a dose of common sense
customer_reviews.author: m_c_c_o_y

customer_reviews.title: Ordered all kinds of stuff after a horrible case of poison oak 2 months ago from working ...
customer_reviews.text: Used a weed eater all weekend in an area that has A LOT of poison oak, so I'm sure it was all over me and my clothes. Showered with dish soap as soon as I finished, and so far not a single red spot on me. Ordered all kinds of stuff after a horrible case of poison oak 2 months ago from working in the same area; this is the only non-prescription item I got that worked.
customer_reviews.author: lafn1996

customer_reviews.title: Might work but not my first choice for protection.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and used it a few times last summer and it might have done some good. The problems is that you have to know your going to be in poison ivy or oak to use it and you can still breath the poison oil in after you mow over it. It also feels funky on the skin, I think it is mostly witchhazel. I can say that another product Amazon sells "Oral Ivy" a homeopathic remedy worked very well for me.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Ivy-X is effective in preventing the oil from poison ivy from getting on your skin if you apply it prior to working outside. I used to buy Ivy Block but since that is no longer available I tried Ivy-X and so far it has been effective.
customer_reviews.author: Althea P.

customer_reviews.title: Strange concept but seems to work
customer_reviews.text: The ads say this closes the pores to prevent the poison oils from getting in your skin. The ingredients are similar to those products that dissolve the poison oils. I won't question it too much, however, because I am very allergic to poison ivy and have vine upon vine on the property edge and after applying this product, I have not had any allergic reactions from PI. Worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: James W White

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was more of a gel for easier application - the liquid is easy to spill and hard to see because it looks ...
customer_reviews.text: This solution helps me from getting poison ivy, when I know I am going to come into contact with it at the back of my property, not matter how many precautions I take. Wish it was more of a gel for easier application - the liquid is easy to spill and hard to see because it looks like water. I will not be without this product anytime of year, as I can get exposed to Poison Ivy year round in my area. Superb product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: REALLY WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who has been exposed to poison ivy twice. She went to the doctor and was given a cream which didn't seem to work. Now she uses Ivy X to prevent it and it has worked so far
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Kittelson

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Could not do a lot of yard work without this as the property borders woods with poison ivy EVERYWHERE. I am extremely allergic and this saved my bacon every time I used it. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for camping and gardening
customer_reviews.text: What a life saver for me and my family. I had no idea I was so very allergic to poison sumac until I had it! Now anytime I'm in the garden or out in the words I use this and ours saved me from more another outbreak! I even gave a bottle to a friend who is a tree Cutter And they love it also!
customer_reviews.author: wendy Bloome

customer_reviews.title: Umm, doesn't do what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Did not prevent getting poison oak on my last run. What is the point?
customer_reviews.author: DYLAN K. MACDONALD

customer_reviews.title: This product works great to keep us out of our bumper crop of ...
customer_reviews.text: This product works great to keep us out of our bumper crop of poison ivy this year! We have had zero trips to the doctor for steroid shots this year to fight poison ivy! Yay!!
customer_reviews.author: M. A.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived promptly. I am not sure it works for ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly. I am not sure it works for me. I am still getting poison ivy rash even though I spray this all over my arms and legs and neck before gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me, but others I know love it.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me, though it has worked for those I have talked to.
customer_reviews.author: Baldylox81

customer_reviews.title: I have used this product for pre-contact exposure to poison ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for pre-contact exposure to poison oak for about 15 years (combined with Tecnu for cleanup afterwards) and have found it highly effective. I'm careful to avoid handling my clothing and shoes after cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Fish

customer_reviews.title: This works!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this product. He is highly susceptible to poison ivy and this actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Erika S.

customer_reviews.title: ... working regularly around poison and so far has worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Have been working regularly around poison and so far has worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M. Decker

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product as directed and got a terrible case of poison oak. After contacting Amazon customer service I received a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: toebiter

customer_reviews.title: Keeps exposure to a minimum
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well for my husband who is highly allergic to poison ivy.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Beardsley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better tha Ivy-Block. Much easier to apply as a spray!
customer_reviews.author: Forrest E. Oglesby, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This was a "refill. " I'd used up my ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a "refill." I'd used up my previous bottle.
customer_reviews.author: TerryA

customer_reviews.title: Not a miracle cream, but helps a tiny bit.
customer_reviews.text: For minor contact dermatitis of Poison Oak and Ivy it is "ok" but not a life saver. For more serious attacks, or if it has turned into a solid red area from scratching, this won't help much. Try taking both H1 and H2 histamine inhibitors, such as Benadryl (Diphenhydramine) + Pepcid (famotidine) [note both are over the counter and I am NOT a doctor, just mentioning]. Still, for minor itching/rashes this seems to help a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Books Still Matter (dot NET)

customer_reviews.title: this works!
customer_reviews.text: has been working really well! I am VERY allergic to poison ivy- so glad to have this in my tool box, now :)
customer_reviews.author: Barbara C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. I tecnu/oak soap/dawn dish soap after contact and I still ended up with a prescription for Prednisone.
customer_reviews.author: Dargen

customer_reviews.title: Works..
customer_reviews.text: Although I followed up with TECNU after pulling ropes of poison ive from the trees and the ground, I think I got better results using IvyX first. Watch out. The last time there was a product out that actually worked for this, the next year it was off the market. Like Junket fudge. Best fudge and cake icing in the world and just gone..... although the company is still going. Who knows why???
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: ... any of the plants and got posion ivy so bad a week ago
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product every time I think I might come in contact with any of the plants and got posion ivy so bad a week ago, I had to go get a shot... But to be honest, the doc said I am super allergic to it so probably won't anything really work for me...
customer_reviews.author: Tammie Blount

customer_reviews.title: I am highly allergic to poison ivy and have a ...
customer_reviews.text: I am highly allergic to poison ivy and have a lot of it at the edges of my yard. If I even get a brush of one piece of a leaf or a scattering of dirt from around the stuff I am in for two weeks of weeping and steroids. I put the block all over my face this year before tackling some vine removal (along with disposable clothing, sweat band and gauntlets) and so far I have cleared some of the vines back from the edge and NO outbreaks. Hurrah!!! Priscilla
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla E Theberge

customer_reviews.title: Works  No more rashes
customer_reviews.text: I am highly allergic to poison ivy with severe Rhus dermatitis several times a summer. I wash off with this product after working in the yard now for over a year without a single rash. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: PETER Z.

customer_reviews.title: Working so far !
customer_reviews.text: Used it several times and no poison ivy - I get 1-2 episodes each summer and so far so good. Quick ship and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: arthrodoc

customer_reviews.title: so good. As a person who seems to be able ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. As a person who seems to be able to find the only poison ivy for miles in any vicinity, I've been very happy with this pre-contact gel. I've used it every time I've gone out to garden for a month and, unlike each of the previous 7 years, have not had any contact issues with ivy - and I know we have some, we always do no matter how much of it I kill. I use this in conjunction with the Tecnu wash and the combination has been a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Biegen

customer_reviews.title: very mild case of poison ivy (which is pretty good considering I was pulling yards and yards of ...
customer_reviews.text: This actually works. I use it when I am removing poison ivy from the wooded area in our backyard. Just be sure to reapply often! I also use the Oral Ivy from April through November which does wonders as well. One day while working in the yard I decided that the Oral Ivy was enough and didn't bother applying this. I got a very, very mild case of poison ivy (which is pretty good considering I was pulling yards and yards of vines out). Using a combination of this and oral ivy I have never gotten anything.
customer_reviews.author: LWR55

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My husband got a bad case of poison ivy when working in the woods on our property. It was so severe he had to go to the Dr. who prescribed an ointment which eventually cleared it up. She recommended a barrier spray if he was exposed again so we bought IvyX. My husband has used it and has not had any more problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: i wish it was Ivy Block, but...
customer_reviews.text: this is the only item I have seen on the market that works *almost* as good as the now-discontinued "Ivy Block" item. I used Ivy Block for years prior to it being discontinued by the manufacturer. Therefore I was forced to switch to another brand of Uriserol blocker! This item works satisfactorily but please also be sure to dress appropriately and also to wash, wash, wash the heck out of affected skin areas after exposure!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Barnes

customer_reviews.title: I'm exceptionally prone to poison ivy. We frequently hike ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm exceptionally prone to poison ivy. We frequently hike in summer, and work in parks all year, so I'm exposed to poison on nearly a daily basis. Using this on legs, arms & face has made what used to be a non-stop rash become much less frequent.
customer_reviews.author: Kalee

customer_reviews.title: A must for gardeners!
customer_reviews.text: I am really sensitive to Poison Ivy and since I discovered this product I have had far fewer episodes. Make sure to reapply if you take a work break and/or wash up. Have gifted several bottles to other gardeners and they were pleased.
customer_reviews.author: sbc

customer_reviews.title: For those times your just not sure...
customer_reviews.text: After being exposed to poison Ivy somewhere on a hike, I decided to buy and start using the contact solution. So far, no new instances of poison ivy.
customer_reviews.author: bridgetocross

customer_reviews.title: I react badly to poison ivy and this doesn't stop ...
customer_reviews.text: I react badly to poison ivy and this doesn't stop all of it but keeps the reaction a lot less. Could be I've not got it covered enough.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Putnam

customer_reviews.title: glad you carry this product
customer_reviews.text: it saves my husband trips to the doctor .glad you carry this product.
customer_reviews.author: dorothea

customer_reviews.title: No more STEROIDS!
customer_reviews.text: I can't guarantee that I came into direct contact with any poison ivy, but I've been super close and NO POISON IVY. I hope I never have to take steroids for P.I. again. Thanks IvyX!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie McMahon

customer_reviews.title: This really works!
customer_reviews.text: I am highly allergic to poison ivy. When used properly, this stopped a reaction from even starting. A must have for anyone who loves the outdoors but is prone to contact dermatitis.
customer_reviews.author: Been Jammin'

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: I use this product every time I go out in the woods and it has helped so far to keep poison ivy off me. I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Poole

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kinda creates a barrier of sticky type non breathable gel. Im sure it kept some off but gross feeling!
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Mac

customer_reviews.title: Good preventive
customer_reviews.text: A good product. I always cover myself from neck to toe but being quite allergic to poisonous plants I wanted additional protection.
customer_reviews.author: M. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Good product but prefer the wipes.
customer_reviews.text: Have better luck with the wipes but its still a good product. Too time consuming for my professional needs. Probably fine for the weekend gardeners.
customer_reviews.author: JoniJ

customer_reviews.title: Rash doesn't start
customer_reviews.text: love this stuff, I live in the woods and it keeps the poison away.
customer_reviews.author: Sue W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I get poison ivy very easily and so far this product has protected me. Hooray!
customer_reviews.author: ELEddy

customer_reviews.title: Appears to work fine, but until we have more exposure to poison ...
customer_reviews.text: Appears to work fine, but until we have more exposure to poison ivy we won't know for sure. Service and delivery excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy Hill Guys

customer_reviews.title: ... to poison ivy as I am you will be disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: If you are highly allergic to poison ivy as I am you will be disappointed with this product. It doesn't work. NOTHING works against poison ivy except steering clear of it. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie C. Mahin

customer_reviews.title: Great for working Caustic woods
customer_reviews.text: I work with exotic woods the dust of some results in Poison Ivy type allergy. Cocobolo is beautiful but caustic. This solution prevents any reaction to the dust.
customer_reviews.author: Mark  D. Elliott Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A protectant that works.
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to work for me. I've contracted contact dermatitis which is eluding physicians' scrutiny. In desperation, I ordered Ivy X to see if it would help. It has helped, apparently, because I've had no breakouts in areas where it is applied. SO, I ordered a case of it. In time, I'm sure the doctors will deduce the offending irritant, but in the meantime, I'm grateful for this product. Evidently, It doesn't just work on poison ivy. It protects the skin from other irritants, too.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa S Meyerer

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: The product works. I've used it twice and have not gotten any rashes due to Ivy or Oak. I like the price.
customer_reviews.author: irishmike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for me, considering I get poison ivy every summer!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: ... product and so far it seams to be working fine. I have a few very small contact rashes ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 1st time I've tried this product and so far it seams to be working fine. I have a few very small contact rashes still from touching plants but not the overall outbreak I would normally get from it. I will continue to use it and would recommend it and have already.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Earle

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: This product did not help me at all I put it on 2 hour prior to being exposed to poison ivy on a hunting trip and with in 48 hours latera I broke out all over my body and really bad on my forearms
customer_reviews.author: Perez Fam

product_meta.title: Poison Oak and Ivy Pre Contact Ivy X 4 Oz Solution (1 Bottle)
product_meta.description: CoreTex offers a full line of Poison Ivy Barriers. Ivy X Pre-Contact Barrier is an invisible barrier to help protect against poisonous plant oils (Urushiol) commonly found in Poison Ivy, Poison Oak and Poison Sumac. Our packaging allows for a compliant and affordable skin care program to help in poisonous plant protection. WARNING: This product can expose you to chemicals which is [are] known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm. For more information go to www.P65Warnings.ca.gov.
feature_bullets: Helps in preventing Poison Ivy, Oak & Sumac rashes before they start
Hours of protection with one application
